Author: j4jackj
Text: i hate to be that person but 7-8 is a moderately poor A1c (though it is the mainstream treatment target), which results in pubertal growth restriction and microvascular diabetic complications due to chronic hyperglycemia. 4-6 is what I'd call a good A1c (if you are having less than 2 hypos a month while getting such  results), but I come from the low carb world where we seem to be developing a mass hysteria of anorexia so I'm after fleeing here basically to report on my community's idiocy.  btw, "x is after y'ing" is Irish English for "x y'ed." There is not an acceptable-to-me past tense of 'flee', so I've decided to do the Irish English version of past tense.

Author: Popular-Independence
Text: I would recommend you eat the diet (and follow the exercise program) of [masteringdiabetes.org](https://www.masteringdiabetes.org/diabetes-nutrition-guidelines/). A real health promoting diet should fix all your problems.  Young women should look like this: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vnao305hHNY](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vnao305hHNY). You WILL look like this if you eat properly and exercise properly.  If you're not doing a lot of strength training your BMI should be around 20 not 25+.
